keyword: calories in a cup of ground beef
title: Calories in a Cup of Ground Beef
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of ground beef, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Ground Beef
assumptions: 80% lean ground beef, cooked (pan-browned), drained of fat, crumbled; 1 cup ≈ 226 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by lean percentage, cooking method, added fats/seasonings, and exact measurement. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A cup of cooked 80% lean ground beef provides ~565 kcal and ~59 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil per 100 g during cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: About 565 kcal for 1 cup (226 g) of 80% lean, cooked and drained.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a cup of ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 59 g protein per cup of cooked 80% lean ground beef.

faqs.q: Does lean percentage affect calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—90% lean has fewer calories (~384 kcal per cup) than 80% lean due to less fat.

faqs.q: Are these values for cooked or raw ground beef?
faqs.a: Cooked and drained; raw is lower in calories per volume but shrinks when cooked.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a cup of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 36 g total fat, including 15 g saturated, for 80% lean cooked.
